title: Existentialism
description: Dive into the philosophy of existence, freedom, and authenticity

questions.question: Which philosopher is often called the 'father of existentialism'?
Jean-Paul Sartre's famous declaration 'existence precedes essence' means what?
options: We are defined by our choices, not a predetermined nature

questions.question: What is 'bad faith' (mauvaise foi) in Sartre's philosophy?
Nietzsche's concept of the 'Ubermensch' (Overman) represents what?
options: An individual who creates their own values and meaning

questions.question: In Camus's 'The Myth of Sisyphus,' what does Sisyphus's endless boulder-rolling symbolize?
options: The absurd condition of human existence

questions.question: Which existentialist philosopher wrote 'Being and Nothingness'?
Heidegger's concept of 'Dasein' refers to what?
Simone de Beauvoir's 'The Second Sex' applied existentialist ideas to what topic?
What did Nietzsche mean when he declared 'God is dead'?
options: That traditional moral foundations based on religion had lost their power
That he was an atheist preacher

questions.question: Kierkegaard identified three stages of existence. What are they?
What is 'existential angst' or 'anxiety'?
options: A deep sense of dread arising from human freedom and responsibility

questions.question: Which existentialist wrote the play 'No Exit,' containing the famous line 'Hell is other people'?
Franz Kafka's novels, while not strictly existentialist, explore themes of what?
What does 'authenticity' mean in existentialist philosophy?
options: Living in accordance with one's true self and freedom
